00119   typedef unsigned char DES_cblock[8];
00120   typedef /* const */ unsigned char const_DES_cblock[8];
00121   /* With "const", gcc 2.8.1 on Solaris thinks that DES_cblock *
00122    * and const_DES_cblock * are incompatible pointer types. */
00123 
00124   typedef struct DES_ks {
00125     union {
00126       DES_cblock cblock;
00127       /* make sure things are correct size on machines with
00128        * 8 byte longs */
00129       DES_LONG deslong[2];
00130     } ks[16];
00131 #ifdef OCTEON_OPENSSL
00132     uint64_t cvmkey;
00133 #endif
00134   } DES_key_schedule;
00135 
00136 #ifndef OPENSSL_DISABLE_OLD_DES_SUPPORT
00137 # ifndef OPENSSL_ENABLE_OLD_DES_SUPPORT
00138 #  define OPENSSL_ENABLE_OLD_DES_SUPPORT
00139 # endif
00140 #endif
00141 
00142 #ifdef OPENSSL_ENABLE_OLD_DES_SUPPORT
00143 # include <openssl/des_old.h>
00144 #endif
00145 
00146 #define DES_KEY_SZ  (sizeof(DES_cblock))
00147 #define DES_SCHEDULE_SZ (sizeof(DES_key_schedule))
00148 
00149 #define DES_ENCRYPT 1
00150 #define DES_DECRYPT 0
00151 
00152 #define DES_CBC_MODE    0
00153 #define DES_PCBC_MODE   1
00154 
00155 #define DES_ecb2_encrypt(i,o,k1,k2,e) \
00156     DES_ecb3_encrypt((i),(o),(k1),(k2),(k1),(e))
00157 
00158 #define DES_ede2_cbc_encrypt(i,o,l,k1,k2,iv,e) \
00159     DES_ede3_cbc_encrypt((i),(o),(l),(k1),(k2),(k1),(iv),(e))
00160 
00161 #define DES_ede2_cfb64_encrypt(i,o,l,k1,k2,iv,n,e) \
00162     DES_ede3_cfb64_encrypt((i),(o),(l),(k1),(k2),(k1),(iv),(n),(e))
00163 
00164 #define DES_ede2_ofb64_encrypt(i,o,l,k1,k2,iv,n) \
00165     DES_ede3_ofb64_encrypt((i),(o),(l),(k1),(k2),(k1),(iv),(n))
00166 
00167     OPENSSL_DECLARE_GLOBAL (int, DES_check_key);        /* defaults to false */
00168 #define DES_check_key OPENSSL_GLOBAL_REF(DES_check_key)
00169     OPENSSL_DECLARE_GLOBAL (int, DES_rw_mode);  /* defaults to DES_PCBC_MODE */
00170 #define DES_rw_mode OPENSSL_GLOBAL_REF(DES_rw_mode)

00174     DES_key_schedule * ks1, DES_key_schedule * ks2,
00175     DES_key_schedule * ks3, int enc);
00176   DES_LONG DES_cbc_cksum (const unsigned char *input, DES_cblock * output,
00177     long length, DES_key_schedule * schedule, const_DES_cblock * ivec);
00178   /* DES_cbc_encrypt does not update the IV!  Use DES_ncbc_encrypt instead. */
00179   void DES_cbc_encrypt (const unsigned char *input, unsigned char *output,
00180     long length, DES_key_schedule * schedule, DES_cblock * ivec, int enc);
00181   void DES_ncbc_encrypt (const unsigned char *input, unsigned char *output,

00183   void DES_xcbc_encrypt (const unsigned char *input, unsigned char *output,

00185     const_DES_cblock * inw, const_DES_cblock * outw, int enc);

00187     int numbits, long length, DES_key_schedule * schedule,
00188     DES_cblock * ivec, int enc);
00189   void DES_ecb_encrypt (const_DES_cblock * input, DES_cblock * output,
00190     DES_key_schedule * ks, int enc);
00191 
00192   /*      This is the DES encryption function that gets called by just about
00193      every other DES routine in the library.  You should not use this
00194      function except to implement 'modes' of DES.  I say this because the
00195      functions that call this routine do the conversion from 'char *' to
00196      long, and this needs to be done to make sure 'non-aligned' memory
00197      access do not occur.  The characters are loaded 'little endian'.
00198      Data is a pointer to 2 unsigned long's and ks is the
00199      DES_key_schedule to use.  enc, is non zero specifies encryption,
00200      zero if decryption. */
00201   void DES_encrypt1 (DES_LONG * data, DES_key_schedule * ks, int enc);
00202 
00203   /*      This functions is the same as DES_encrypt1() except that the DES
00204      initial permutation (IP) and final permutation (FP) have been left
00205      out.  As for DES_encrypt1(), you should not use this function.
00206      It is used by the routines in the library that implement triple DES.
00207      IP() DES_encrypt2() DES_encrypt2() DES_encrypt2() FP() is the same
00208      as DES_encrypt1() DES_encrypt1() DES_encrypt1() except faster :-). */
00209   void DES_encrypt2 (DES_LONG * data, DES_key_schedule * ks, int enc);
00210 
00211   void DES_encrypt3 (DES_LONG * data, DES_key_schedule * ks1,
00212     DES_key_schedule * ks2, DES_key_schedule * ks3);
00213   void DES_decrypt3 (DES_LONG * data, DES_key_schedule * ks1,
00214     DES_key_schedule * ks2, DES_key_schedule * ks3);
00215   void DES_ede3_cbc_encrypt (const unsigned char *input,
00216     unsigned char *output, long length, DES_key_schedule * ks1,
00217     DES_key_schedule * ks2, DES_key_schedule * ks3, DES_cblock * ivec,
00218     int enc);
00219   void DES_ede3_cbcm_encrypt (const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00220     long length, DES_key_schedule * ks1, DES_key_schedule * ks2,
00221     DES_key_schedule * ks3, DES_cblock * ivec1, DES_cblock * ivec2,
00222     int enc);
00223   void DES_ede3_cfb64_encrypt (const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00224     long length, DES_key_schedule * ks1, DES_key_schedule * ks2,
00225     DES_key_schedule * ks3, DES_cblock * ivec, int *num, int enc);
00226   void DES_ede3_ofb64_encrypt (const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00227     long length, DES_key_schedule * ks1, DES_key_schedule * ks2,
00228     DES_key_schedule * ks3, DES_cblock * ivec, int *num);

00231     const_DES_cblock * in_white, DES_cblock * out_white);

00246   int DES_random_key (DES_cblock * ret);
00247   void DES_set_odd_parity (DES_cblock * key);
00248   int DES_check_key_parity (const_DES_cblock * key);
00249   int DES_is_weak_key (const_DES_cblock * key);
00250   /* DES_set_key (= set_key = DES_key_sched = key_sched) calls
00251    * DES_set_key_checked if global variable DES_check_key is set,
00252    * DES_set_key_unchecked otherwise. */
00253   int DES_set_key (const_DES_cblock * key, DES_key_schedule * schedule);
00254   int DES_key_sched (const_DES_cblock * key, DES_key_schedule * schedule);
00255   int DES_set_key_checked (const_DES_cblock * key,
00256     DES_key_schedule * schedule);
00257   void DES_set_key_unchecked (const_DES_cblock * key,
00258     DES_key_schedule * schedule);
00259   void DES_string_to_key (const char *str, DES_cblock * key);
00260   void DES_string_to_2keys (const char *str, DES_cblock * key1,
00261     DES_cblock * key2);

00263     long length, DES_key_schedule * schedule, DES_cblock * ivec, int *num,
00264     int enc);
00265   void DES_ofb64_encrypt (const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00266     long length, DES_key_schedule * schedule, DES_cblock * ivec, int *num);

00268   int DES_read_password (DES_cblock * key, const char *prompt, int verify);
00269   int DES_read_2passwords (DES_cblock * key1, DES_cblock * key2,
00270     const char *prompt, int verify);

00272 #define DES_fixup_key_parity DES_set_odd_parity
00273 
00274 #define TDES_CBC_MD5_SUCCESS             0
00275 #define TDES_CBC_MD5_INVALID_ARGUMENT   -1
00276 #define TDES_CBC_MD5_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL   -2
00277 
00278 /** 
00279  * 3DES-CBC-MD5 Encryption
00280  * This function creates an IPSEC outbound packet using 3DES-CBC & HMAC-MD5
00281  * keys provided
00282  * @param des_key      [in] 3DES encryption key (must be of 24 bytes in length)
00283  * @param md5_keylen   [in] HMAC-MD5 key length
00284  * @param md5_key      [in] HMAC-MD5 key
00285  * @param espheader    [in] Pointer to the ESP header (must be of 8 bytes in 
00286  * length). It is placed at the start of the output packet
00287  * @param iv           [in] Initialization vector(must be of 8 bytes in length).
00288  *                     It is placed after ESP header in the output packet
00289  * @param input        [in] Pointer to the input payload (to be encrypted)
00290  * @param inputlen     [in] Length of input data (in bytes) pointed to by 
00291  * input parameter. The inputlen should be a multiple of DES block size. 
00292  * This function doesn't pad anything at the end of the input
00293  * @param output       [out] Pointer to the output buffer where encrypted and
00294  * authenticated packet should be placed
00295  * @param outputlen    [in/out] Length of output buffer (in bytes). The 
00296  * function returns the number of bytes placed in the output buffer. If output
00297  * buffer provided is too small, no operation is performed and the size of 
00298  * output buffer required to perform the operation is placed in this parameter
00299  * @return             TDES_CBC_MD5_SUCCESS (0)
00300  *                     TDES_CBC_MD5_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-1)
00301  *                     TDES_CBC_MD5_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL (-2)
00302 */
00303   int DES_ede3_cbc_md5_encrypt (uint8_t * des_key, uint16_t md5_keylen,
00304     uint8_t * md5_key, uint8_t * espheader, uint8_t * iv, uint8_t * input,
00305     uint16_t inputlen, uint8_t * output, uint16_t * outputlen);
00306 /** 
00307  * 3DES-CBC-MD5 Decryption
00308  * This function authenticates & decrypts an inbound IPSEC packet using the
00309  * 3DES-CBC and HMAC-MD5 keys provided
00310  * @param des_key      [in] 3DES decryption key (must be of 24 bytes in length)
00311  * @param md5_keylen   [in] HMAC-MD5 key length
00312  * @param md5_key      [in] HMAC-MD5 key
00313  * @param iv           Initialization vector (must be of 8 bytes in length).
00314  * @param input        Pointer to the IPSEC packet (i.e, points to ESP header)
00315  * @param inputlen     Length of IPSEC packet pointed to by input. It should
00316  * include the 
00317  * ESP header (8 bytes) + IV (8 bytes) + PAYLOAD length + HMAC (12 bytes)
00318  * @param output       Pointer to the output buffer where decrypted and 
00319  * authenticated packet should be placed
00320  * @param outputlen    Length of output buffer (in bytes). The function 
00321  * returns the number of bytes placed in the output buffer. If output buffer
00322  * provided is too small, no operation is performed and the size of output 
00323  * buffer required to perform the operation is placed in this buffer
00324  * @param compdigest   If this is non-zero, then the IPSEC packet is
00325  * authenticated first. If the  authentication succeeds, then the packet is
00326  * decrypted.If this is 0, then the IPSEC packet is not authenticated. The 
00327  * IPSEC packet is decrypted and HMAC is placed at the end of the decrypted
00328  * packet
00329  * @return             TDES_CBC_MD5_SUCCESS (0)
00330  *                     TDES_CBC_MD5_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-1)
00331  *                     TDES_CBC_MD5_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL (-2)
00332 */
00333   int DES_ede3_cbc_md5_decrypt (uint8_t * des_key, uint16_t md5_keylen,
00334     uint8_t * md5_key, uint8_t * iv, uint8_t * input, uint16_t inputlen,
00335     uint8_t * output, uint16_t * outputlen, uint8_t compdigest);
00336 
00337 #define TDES_CBC_SHA_SUCCESS             0
00338 #define TDES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_ARGUMENT   -1
00339 #define TDES_CBC_SHA_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL   -2
00340 
00341 /** 
00342  * 3DES-CBC-SHA1 Encryption
00343  * This function creates an IPSEC outbound packet using 3DES-CBC & HMAC-SHA1 
00344  * keys provided
00345  * @param des_key      [in] 3DES encryption key (must be of 24 bytes in length)
00346  * @param sha1_keylen  [in] HMAC-SHA1 key length
00347  * @param sha1_key     [in] HMAC-SHA1 key
00348  * @param espheader    [in] Pointer to the ESP header (must be of 8 bytes in
00349  * length). It is placed at the start of the output packet
00350  * @param iv           [in] Initialization vector(must be of 8 bytes in length).
00351  *                     It is placed after ESP header in the output packet
00352  * @param input        [in] Pointer to the input payload (to be encrypted)
00353  * @param inputlen     [in] Length of input data (in bytes) pointed to by 
00354  * input parameter. The inputlen should be a multiple of DES block size. This
00355  * function doesn't pad anything at the end of the input
00356  * @param output       [out] Pointer to the output buffer where encrypted and
00357  * authenticated packet should be placed
00358  * @param outputlen    [in/out] Length of output buffer (in bytes). The
00359  * function returns the number of bytes placed in the output buffer. If output
00360  * buffer provided is too small, no operation is performed and the size of 
00361  * output buffer required to perform the operation is placed in this parameter
00362  * @return             TDES_CBC_SHA_SUCCESS (0)
00363  *                     TDES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-1)
00364  *                     TDES_CBC_SHA_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL (-2)
00365 */
00366   int DES_ede3_cbc_sha1_encrypt (uint8_t * des_key, uint16_t sha1_keylen,
00367     uint8_t * sha1_key, uint8_t * espheader, uint8_t * iv, uint8_t * input,
00368     uint16_t inputlen, uint8_t * output, uint16_t * outputlen);
00369 /** 
00370  * 3DES-CBC-SHA1 Decryption
00371  * This function authenticates & decrypts an inbound IPSEC packet using the
00372  * 3DES-CBC and HMAC-SHA1 keys provided
00373  * @param des_key      [in] 3DES decryption key (must be of 24 bytes in length)
00374  * @param sha1_keylen   [in] HMAC-SHA1 key length
00375  * @param sha1_key      [in] HMAC-SHA1 key
00376  * @param iv           Initialization vector (must be of 8 bytes in length).
00377  * @param input        Pointer to the IPSEC packet (i.e, points to ESP header)
00378  * @param inputlen     Length of IPSEC packet pointed to by input. It should
00379  * include the 
00380  * ESP header (8 bytes) + IV (8 bytes) + PAYLOAD length + HMAC (12 bytes)
00381  * @param output       Pointer to the output buffer where decrypted and
00382  * authenticated  packet should be placed
00383  * @param outputlen    Length of output buffer (in bytes). The function
00384  * returns the number of bytes placed in the output buffer. If output buffer
00385  * provided is too small, no operation is performed and the size of output
00386  * buffer required to perform the operation is placed in this buffer
00387  * @param compdigest   If this is non-zero, then the IPSEC packet is 
00388  * authenticated first. If the authentication succeeds, then the packet is
00389  * decrypted.If this is 0, then the IPSEC packet is not authenticated. The 
00390  * IPSEC packet is decrypted and HMAC is placed at the end of the decrypted
00391  * packet
00392  * @return             TDES_CBC_SHA_SUCCESS (0)
00393  *                     TDES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-1)
00394  *                     TDES_CBC_SHA_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL (-2)
00395 */
00396   int DES_ede3_cbc_sha1_decrypt (uint8_t * des_key, uint16_t sha1_keylen,
00397     uint8_t * sha1_key, uint8_t * iv, uint8_t * input, uint16_t inputlen,
00398     uint8_t * output, uint16_t * outputlen, uint8_t compdigest);
00399 /** 
00400  * 3DES-CBC-SHA224 Encryption
00401  * This function creates an IPSEC outbound packet using 3DES-CBC & HMAC-SHA224
00402  * keys provided
00403  * @param des_key      [in] 3DES encryption key (must be of 24 bytes in length)
00404  * @param sha224_keylen  [in] HMAC-SHA224 key length
00405  * @param sha224_key     [in] HMAC-SHA224 key
00406  * @param espheader    [in] Pointer to the ESP header (must be of 8 bytes in 
00407  * length). It is placed at the start of the output packet
00408  * @param iv           [in] Initialization vector(must be of 8 bytes in length).
00409  *                     It is placed after ESP header in the output packet
00410  * @param input        [in] Pointer to the input payload (to be encrypted)
00411  * @param inputlen     [in] Length of input data (in bytes) pointed to by 
00412  * input parameter. The inputlen should be a multiple of DES block size. This
00413  * function doesn't pad anything at the end of the input
00414  * @param output       [out] Pointer to the output buffer where encrypted and
00415  * authenticated packet should be placed
00416  * @param outputlen    [in/out] Length of output buffer (in bytes). The 
00417  * function returns the number of bytes placed in the output buffer. If output
00418  * buffer provided is too small, no operation is performed and the size of 
00419  * output buffer required to perform the operation is placed in this parameter
00420  * @return             TDES_CBC_SHA_SUCCESS (0)
00421  *                     TDES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-1)
00422  *                     TDES_CBC_SHA_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL (-2)
00423 */
00424   int DES_ede3_cbc_sha224_encrypt (uint8_t * des_key,
00425     uint16_t sha224_keylen, uint8_t * sha224_key, uint8_t * espheader,
00426     uint8_t * iv, uint8_t * input, uint16_t inputlen, uint8_t * output,
00427     uint16_t * outputlen);
00428 /** 
00429  * 3DES-CBC-SHA224 Decryption
00430  * This function authenticates & decrypts an inbound IPSEC packet using the
00431  * 3DES-CBC and HMAC-SHA224 keys provided
00432  * @param des_key      [in] 3DES decryption key (must be of 24 bytes in length)
00433  * @param sha224_keylen   [in] HMAC-SHA224 key length
00434  * @param sha224_key      [in] HMAC-SHA224 key
00435  * @param iv           Initialization vector (must be of 8 bytes in length).
00436  * @param input        Pointer to the IPSEC packet (i.e, points to ESP header)
00437  * @param inputlen     Length of IPSEC packet pointed to by input. It should 
00438  * include the 
00439  * ESP header (8 bytes) + IV (8 bytes) + PAYLOAD length + HMAC (12 bytes)
00440  * @param output       Pointer to the output buffer where decrypted and 
00441  * authenticated packet should be placed
00442  * @param outputlen    Length of output buffer (in bytes). The function 
00443  * returns the number of bytes placed in the output buffer. If output buffer
00444  * provided is too small, no operation is performed and the size of output
00445  * buffer required to perform the operation is placed in this buffer
00446  * @param compdigest   If this is non-zero, then the IPSEC packet is 
00447  * authenticated first. If the authentication succeeds, then the packet is 
00448  * decrypted. If this is 0, then the IPSEC packet is not authenticated. The
00449  * IPSEC packet is decrypted and HMAC is placed at the end of the decrypted
00450  * packet
00451  * @return             TDES_CBC_SHA_SUCCESS (0)
00452  *                     TDES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-1)
00453  *                     TDES_CBC_SHA_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL (-2)
00454 */
00455   int DES_ede3_cbc_sha224_decrypt (uint8_t * des_key,
00456     uint16_t sha224_keylen, uint8_t * sha224_key, uint8_t * iv,
00457     uint8_t * input, uint16_t inputlen, uint8_t * output,
00458     uint16_t * outputlen, uint8_t compdigest);
00459 /** 
00460  * 3DES-CBC-SHA256 Encryption
00461  * This function creates an IPSEC outbound packet using 3DES-CBC & HMAC-SHA256
00462  * keys provided
00463  * @param des_key      [in] 3DES encryption key (must be of 24 bytes in length)
00464  * @param sha256_keylen  [in] HMAC-SHA256 key length
00465  * @param sha256_key     [in] HMAC-SHA256 key
00466  * @param espheader    [in] Pointer to the ESP header (must be of 8 bytes in
00467  * length). It is placed at the start of the output packet
00468  * @param iv           [in] Initialization vector(must be of 8 bytes in length).
00469  *                     It is placed after ESP header in the output packet
00470  * @param input        [in] Pointer to the input payload (to be encrypted)
00471  * @param inputlen     [in] Length of input data (in bytes) pointed to by 
00472  * input parameter. The inputlen should be a multiple of DES block size. 
00473  * This function doesn't pad anything at the end of the input
00474  * @param output       [out] Pointer to the output buffer where encrypted and 
00475  * authenticated packet should be placed
00476  * @param outputlen    [in/out] Length of output buffer (in bytes). The
00477  * function returns the number of bytes placed in the output buffer. If output
00478  * buffer provided is too small, no operation is performed and the size of 
00479  * output buffer required to perform the operation is placed in this parameter
00480  * @return             TDES_CBC_SHA_SUCCESS (0)
00481  *                     TDES_CBC_SHA_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-1)
00482  *                     TDES_CBC_SHA_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL (-2)
00483 */
00484   int DES_ede3_cbc_sha256_encrypt (uint8_t * des_key,
00485     uint16_t sha256_keylen, uint8_t * sha256_key, uint8_t * espheader,
00486     uint8_t * iv, uint8_t * input, uint16_t inputlen, uint8_t * output,
00487     uint16_t * outputlen);
